articles.title: Rupee strengthens against dollar
articles.description: The rupee had been on the downtrend since hitting 22-month high
articles.content: The rupee strengthened against the US dollar at Rs197.87 in the inter-bank market on Wednesday compared with Tuesday’s close of Rs198.46, according to the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP). On May 26, 2022, the rupee closed at an all-time low at Rs202.01 ... [693 chars]

articles.title: Jet ski driver Daniel Patrick Liddell jailed over Murray River crash that killed boy
articles.description: A man who killed a boy on the Murray River when he crashed into him with a jet ski has been jailed for at least two years.
articles.content:
A first-time jet ski driver who was under the influence when he killed a boy and injured another on the Murray River has been jailed for at least two years.
Key points: Teenage boy Cooper Henke was hit and killed by a jet ski in the Murray River at M... [3758 chars]

articles.title: Pakistan, Turkey to shore up strategic, economic ties
articles.description: Countries sign six bilateral MoUs; PM Shehbaz discusses regional, international issues with Turkish FM.
articles.content:
ANKARA: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan welcomes Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif upon his arrival at the Presidential Complex for an official ceremony on Wednesday.—AFP

articles.title: Brisbane physiotherapist Scott Alexander Stuart Mackay jailed for sexually assaulting two patients on the same day
articles.description: Both women, who came forward at different times, told police Scott Alexander Stuart Mackay touched them inappropriately for "up to a minute" during sessions which were to address pain in completely unrelated areas of their bodies.
articles.content:
A Brisbane physiotherapist, who caused "irreparable damage" to two patients he sexually assaulted in what a judge has described as a "considerable breach of trust", has been jailed for three months.
Key points: Both women, who came forward at differe... [2330 chars]

articles.title: Dollar loses Rs4.1 in four trading sessions
articles.description: Greenback's decline linked to reports of expected inflows from IMF, which have compelled speculative forces to retreat.
articles.content: KARACHI: The rupee on Wednesday maintained its upward drive and gained another 59 paise against the US dollar in the interbank market. The local currency has recovered Rs4.14 in the last four sessions after hitting an all-time low at 202.01 on May 26... [1054 chars]

articles.title: New "masked" version of immunotherapy could help fight cancer without causing side effects
articles.description: Many cancer treatments are notoriously savage on the body; they attack healthy cells at the same time as tumor cells, causing a plethora of side effects.
articles.content: Many cancer treatments are notoriously savage on the body; they attack healthy cells at the same time as tumor cells, causing a plethora of side effects. Now, researchers at the University of Chicago's Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering (PME) h... [3587 chars]

articles.title: Monkeypox virus doesn’t spread through air: expert
articles.description: KARACHI: No case of monkeypox disease has so far been reported in Pakistan. It’s usually a self-limiting illness...
articles.content: KARACHI: No case of monkeypox disease has so far been reported in Pakistan. It’s usually a self-limiting illness against which an effective (smallpox) vaccine is already available. Its virus, unlike coronavirus, doesn’t spread through the air and inf... [1670 chars]

articles.title: Grim discovery made after human leg found beside Australian highway
articles.description: Two people have been arrested following the find.
articles.content:
A woman’s body has been found days after a human leg was discovered on the side of a Northern Territory Highway.
Detective Senior Sergeant Paul Morrissey said police will allege a male driver hit an Aboriginal woman along the Stuart Hwy, near Darwin.... [1242 chars]
